instruction: In the research on quantitative analysis of aluminum samples, what kind of spectrum was used?
Output: In the research on quantitative analysis of aluminum samples, a laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS) spectrum was used.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were employed in the analysis of aluminum samples ?
Output: Principal component analysis was employed in the analysis of aluminum samples using the LIBS technique.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the efficiency of the different classical machine learning algorithms in predicting the concentration of aluminum samples?
Output: MSE, RMSE, MAE were chosen to evaluate the efficiency of the different classical machine learning algorithms in predicting the concentration of aluminum samples.

instruction: What dimension reduction technique was applied in the analysis of aluminum samples using the LIBS technique and classical machine learning algorithms?
Output: The dimension reduction technique applied in the analysis of aluminum samples using the LIBS technique and classical machine learning algorithms is principal component analysis (PCA).

instruction: What is the efficiency of the combination of PCA with the KSVR algorithm model in predicting the concentration of aluminum samples compared to other classical machine learning algorithms in the research on quantitative analysis using the LIBS technique?
Output: The efficiency of the combination of PCA with the KSVR algorithm model in predicting the concentration of aluminum samples is the highest among other classical machine learning algorithms in the research on quantitative analysis using the LIBS technique.
